pageContent:
SOLOMON GARDNER 
Washington, DC Metro Area 
solomon.g.gardner@gmail.com Phone: (240) 300-9939 
 
 
Solomon is an accomplished professional with over 10 years of demonstrated achievements in Technical 
Leadership, Program/Project Management, and Business Analysis in the areas of Data Engineering, 
Reporting & Data Analytics, Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, Data Management, Informatica ETL 
Design/Development, AWS Cloud Engineering and Business Development with extensive experience 
servicing Federal, Energy, Pharmaceutical, Life Sciences, and Financial industry clients. Solomon has 
worked with cross-functional teams, managing interfaces and dependencies. He has strong Inter-personal 
skills, work ethics, valuable experience, maturity, and ability to look at the big picture as well as the finer 
details along with the Communication skills to convey solutions and deliver findings to management teams.

details along with the Communication skills to convey solutions and deliver findings to management teams. 
• Completed several lifecycle implementations of systems and applications involving all aspects of the 
SDLC  including Project  Management, Business Analysis, Requirements gathering Architecture, 
Design, Development, Testing, Deployment using best practices, methodologies, and standards 
• Expertise   in   Project   Management   (Waterfall,   Agile),   setting   up   Governance   mechanisms, 
Standards,  Best  Practices,  building  capacity  in  support  of  Data  Management,  Reporting  and 
Analytics 
• Practical  understanding  of  the  Data  modeling  (Dimensional  &  Relational)  concepts  like  Star 
Schema  Modeling,  Snowflake  Modeling,  fact  and  dimension  tables.  Implemented  Kimball  and 
Inmon Methodologies based on the Clients reporting needs. 
• Expertise in Data Modeling, Data Architecture, Data Profiling, Data Quality and Extract, Transform,

Inmon Methodologies based on the Clients reporting needs. 
• Expertise in Data Modeling, Data Architecture, Data Profiling, Data Quality and Extract, Transform, 
Load (ETL) of structured and unstructured data 
• Data  Integration/ETL experience using  Informatica, SQL-Server, DTS/SSIS, IBM  InfoSphere 
DataStage, SAP-BODS, DB2 and native Oracle PL/SQL  
• Reporting and Analytics expertise using Cognos, MS PowerBI, Tableau, SAP Business Objects  
• Active Top Secret (Q), Secret, and Public Trust (MBI) Level Security Clearances 
 
EDUCATION 
 
M.S. Computer Science, University of Maryland, MD, USA 
B.S. Management Information Systems, The Ohio State University, OH, USA 
 
PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATIONS 
 
PowerCenter Data Integration 10: Developer, Specialist Certification 
AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner 
 
SECURITY CLEARANCES 
MBI Public Trust Clearance, May 2021 - Sep. 2022 (IRS) 
Top Secret Level Clearance, February 2020 - May 2021 (DOE)

AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner 
 
SECURITY CLEARANCES 
MBI Public Trust Clearance, May 2021 - Sep. 2022 (IRS) 
Top Secret Level Clearance, February 2020 - May 2021 (DOE) 
Secret Level Clearance, November 2016 - April 2017 (Exelon Inc.) 
 
TECHNICAL SKILLS 
ETL: Informatica PowerCenter 8, 9, 10, Informatica IDQ, SQL-Srvr SSIS, DataStage, Alteryx, SAP BODS  
DBMS:  ORACLE 10g, 9i, Greenplum 6, 5, DB2 V, SQL-Server, AWS Redshift. Microsoft Access 
Data Warehousing: STAR and Snowflake Dimensional Modeling, Master Data Management 
Data Modeling Tools: System Architect, Erwin, Rational, COGNOS Framework Manager 
Project Management: Waterfall, Agile, PMP, Prince2, CSM, ITIL, MS Project Server, JIRA 
OLAP/BI: SAP Business Objects v4.3, S/4 HANA, Webi, Cognos BI, Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Qlik 
Languages: C, C++, UNIX-Shells (C, Bourne, Korn), SQL, Transact-SQL, Java, JavaScript, Perl, Python, 
ASP, VB 5.0, ESQL/C, Informix-4GL. Oracle PL/SQL, SQL*Plus, Pro*C, SQL-Loader, COBOL, JCL, XML

Languages: C, C++, UNIX-Shells (C, Bourne, Korn), SQL, Transact-SQL, Java, JavaScript, Perl, Python, 
ASP, VB 5.0, ESQL/C, Informix-4GL. Oracle PL/SQL, SQL*Plus, Pro*C, SQL-Loader, COBOL, JCL, XML 
Operating Systems: HP-UX, AIX, RH Linux, Windows, MVS, DOS 
Quality Assurance/Defect Tracking:  Test Director, Quality Center, Remedy

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE 
 
Data Architect / Infrastructure Lead – Fraud Data Analytics 
Internal Revenue Service (IRS), Accenture, Washington, DC (May 2021-October 2022) 
 
Provided technical leadership as the ETL Development and Infrastructure Lead for the Return Review 
Program (RRP) application which provides a unified system that is integrated into the IRS's modernized 
Infrastructure for the detection of fraudulent returns and refund fraud schemes to ensure timely issuance of 
refunds and credits that are legally due to filers, while preventing issuance of refunds and credits that are not 
legally due to filers.  
• Worked on Massively Parallel Processing, Solution Data Warehouse, rich Operational Data Store 
with approximately over 50K attributes, 800 ETL process, and 200 SQL scripts built using 
Greenplum DB to house key data needed for scoring entities based on sophisticated business rules 
and tax fraud analytic models

Greenplum DB to house key data needed for scoring entities based on sophisticated business rules 
and tax fraud analytic models 
• Technical Lead for Data team (40 members) to bring data from 17 sources (Mainframe, Oracle, Flat 
files and others) into a comprehensive Fraud detection, research and simulation system using 
Informatica PowerCenter, B2B and EMC Greenplum platforms 
• Led a large team of ETL developers which translated data conversion logic into development, test 
plans and scenarios and contributed to dynamic debugging and performance tuning of any ETL 
bottlenecks involved with database, complex mappings, sessions and workflows and recommended 
performance enhancements such as increasing storage capacity or modifying interfaces 
• Developed Informatica ETL for the Return Review Program (RRP) to help identify instances of tax 
return fraud, potential improvements in the IRS approach to prevent, detect, and resolve pre-refund 
tax fraud

return fraud, potential improvements in the IRS approach to prevent, detect, and resolve pre-refund 
tax fraud 
• Architected the overall ETL architecture and load strategy, created templates for capturing ETL 
implementation specifications, and reviewed individual source related ETL design to ensure 
compliance and optimal code reuse 
• Mobilized key Infrastructure initiatives across the RRP as Infrastructure Lead responsible for aligning 
business needs with strategic technology roadmaps by assessing current system capabilities and 
designing future technology architectures to achieve strategic technology plans that align with the 
business strategic initiatives 
• Participated in Writing Test Cases, Executing the Test Scripts, Creating System Test Reports, 
Reporting on Defects and Incident Reports 
• Performed extensive data validation, identifying patterns and trends in data sets 
• Led the Development of canned and adhoc BI/BO Reports and queries executed using the IRS BOE

• Performed extensive data validation, identifying patterns and trends in data sets 
• Led the Development of canned and adhoc BI/BO Reports and queries executed using the IRS BOE 
Common Service which is a IRS-wide business reporting and business intelligence solution based 
on the Business Objects Software suite. RRP uses the BOE solution to implement its Ad-hoc query, 
Ad-hoc Reporting, and Standard Reporting requirements. Tableau was also used for Ad-hoc and 
canned/recurring and Pentaho was used as well for canned/recurring reports 
 
Cloud Migration Engineering / Cloud Migration Architect – DOE CBOSS Cloud Migration 
Department of Energy (DOE), Accenture, Washington, DC (Feb. 2020-May 2021) 
 
Amazon Web ServicesAWS Cloud Migration Service Transition Lead tasked with architecting and managing 
the cloud migration process leveraging AWS infrastructure components including EC2, EBS, RDS, S3, VPC,

the cloud migration process leveraging AWS infrastructure components including EC2, EBS, RDS, S3, VPC, 
SG, CloudFormation, and CodeCommit working alongside a team of engineers to develop cloud data 
solutions.  
• Created cloud migration strategies, delivery architecture, orchestration plans, and more for the 
purpose of migrating 80+ DOE on premise applications to AWS following DOE EITS hosted and 
housed cloud operating models 
• Maintained dashboards and visualizations for application transition that was used to report status to 
Federal leadership. Dashboards utilized by Cloud Operations and Cloud Migration teams to plan for 
upcoming application transitions 
• Led the formal transition process, design, and documentation of both technical and cloud 
environments 
• Managed the application migration process involving the use of JIRA tickets and documentation in 
Confluence following prescribed formats and procedures

• Developed and delivered business proposals to downstream clients generating revenue > $5 million 
• Delivered Rough Order of Magnitude (ROM) and Technical Responses outlining the migration 
approach for the EM Richland and NEPA applications outlining the technical overview, project 
timeline and system specific considerations 
 
Data Analytics Lead – TITAN Data Warehouse 
Department of Treasury, Accenture, Washington, DC (June 2017-October 2019) 
 
Managed ETL Development for the Data Migration work stream responsible for driving the data migration 
strategy from the existing client architecture to a new transactional data model. Spearheaded the technical 
direction/implementation of the TITAN Auction Data Warehouse and participated in the design of Business 
Intelligence (BI) Reports and Analytical Dashboards/Visualizations. 
 
• Achieved a major milestone in December 2018 by leading the completion of ETL Development for

Intelligence (BI) Reports and Analytical Dashboards/Visualizations. 
 
• Achieved a major milestone in December 2018 by leading the completion of ETL Development for 
the Data Migration team on the Kinnewick project. This milestone began with the start of 
requirements analysis in 2017 and was fully delivered December 2018. The overall deliverable 
encompasses client signoff requirements regarding requirements analysis, ETL development, and 
database testing of 180 target tables. 
• Designed and architected the overall data management solution for the migration of client data 
including data flows and networking requirements 
• Created and managed overall project plan and road map with delivery dates for requirement, 
development, and testing phases 
• Facilitated discussions between Business Analysts and client Product Owners to elicit migration 
requirements and data conversion rules 
• Built prototypes and ETL code templates adopting best practices for solution implementation

requirements and data conversion rules 
• Built prototypes and ETL code templates adopting best practices for solution implementation 
• Developed Informatica ETL and tuned for performance by optimizing mapping and sessions, setting 
appropriate cache sizes, identifying source, target, mapping, and session bottlenecks. Used 
Informatica Velocity best practices for ETL/Data Integration 
• Created the STAR schema Data Warehouse Model, ETL Architecture using Informatica, DB2, 
Oracle Database structures and developed the ETL code 
• Developed Conformed dimensions for entities including Bidder, Submitter, Auction, Dealer. 
• Implemented Data Profiling and Data Quality processes 
• Developed 20+ Performance Management Dashboards consisting of 150+ KPIs and charts on 
Tableau that were used by management and employees across multiple departments 
• Generated 100+ canned reports, sub-reports, drill-down reports, drill-through reports, and

Tableau that were used by management and employees across multiple departments 
• Generated 100+ canned reports, sub-reports, drill-down reports, drill-through reports, and 
parameterized reports to provide visible data for data analysts and the business using Tableau 
• Performed analysis and code fixes of complex application Java code to remediate legacy data 
defects 
• Created and managed overall project plan and road map with delivery dates for requirement, 
development, and testing phases 
• Trained Agile Scrum Master and technical SME with delivery-focused responsibilities 
 
Sr. Informatica Developer – Exelon Data Migration 
Exelon Inc., Accenture, Philadelphia, PA (November 2016-April 2017) 
 
Delivered high quality ETL code to perform the data conversion from Entergy Asset Suite 8 (AS8) system to 
the Exelon Passport 10 (PP10) system for the migration of James A. FitzPatrick (JAF) data. The Entergy

the Exelon Passport 10 (PP10) system for the migration of James A. FitzPatrick (JAF) data. The Entergy 
data integration into the Exelon PP10 system involves direct, one to one data loads and also several data 
transformations to introduce the Entergy data into the Exelon data structures while adhering to business 
rules. In total, there were 500-550 tables required for conversion from the Entergy AS8 database to the 
Exelon PP10 DB2 database. 
 
• Displayed strong technical acumen to translate functional business requirements with complex 
processing logic into Informatica ETL processes to perform the migration of Entergy’s JAF data into 
the Exelon PP10 environment 
• Designed, developed, and tested Informatica mappings that were integrated into an overall 
Conversion workflow for migrating Entergy data into an Oracle staging area

• Created 10 reusable lookup tables and 20 reusable expressions used in ETL process that benefitted 
other ETL team members 
• Investigated dependencies, relationships, and implications for code changes between colleagues’ 
ETL process and mitigated any impact 
• Created Informatica mappings using the Transformations like Source qualifier, Aggregator, 
Expression, lookup, Router, Filter, Rank, Sequence Generator, and Update Strategy, XML Parser 
and XML Generator Transformations 
 
Sr. ETL Architect – Fusion Data Management Platform 
AmerisourceBergen Inc., Accenture, Charlotte, NC (April 2016-October 2016) 
 
Defined the ETL Framework and architecture solution for the Fusion Data Management Platform (DMP) at 
the AmerisourceBergen client providing technical leadership driving several key areas for the initiative 
including defining Functional requirements for the DMP, data modeling for the creation of a new Logical and

including defining Functional requirements for the DMP, data modeling for the creation of a new Logical and 
Physical Data Model, and leading the development effort that sunset two legacy client applications into one 
common processing environment leveraging an end-to-end Informatica Solution that replaces 900 legacy 
ETL processes and combines the processing of 1000s of data files into functional areas. 
 
• Designed the high level, end-to-end ETL Framework as the Senior ETL Architect on a Data 
Management initiative to develop a platform that encompasses 900+ legacy ETL processes and 
integration points with Informatica MDM and SalesForce CRM 
• Coordinated design and build activities with an offshore development team of 10 resources and was 
the key point of contact for knowledge transfer and issue resolution 
• Developed ETL prototypes and demos to the client and DMP ETL development team leveraging new

the key point of contact for knowledge transfer and issue resolution 
• Developed ETL prototypes and demos to the client and DMP ETL development team leveraging new 
metadata driven Informatica features in Informatica Developer v10, such as Dynamic Mapping  
• Identified, defined, and presented functional and nonfunctional requirements to the client for the 
Data Management Platform 
• Architected and developed the Data Model, Staging Database, mapping specs and ETL 
Architecture. Created the Data Model and physical data structures using the STAR schema 
methodology  
• Performed dimensional data modeling using the Kimball methodology to invoke new data sources 
• In a Data/ETL Architect role, worked with stakeholders to gather requirements, develop dimensional 
data model, and star schema data marts, documented source to target data mappings and 
corresponding interface documents 
• Implemented Data Profiling and Data Quality processes

data model, and star schema data marts, documented source to target data mappings and 
corresponding interface documents 
• Implemented Data Profiling and Data Quality processes 
• Analyzed business processes, gathered requirements by user interviews, researching legacy 
databases, reports and cubes to create the new Logical and Physical Data model 
 
 
ETL Lead – Novartis Data Migration 
Novartis Inc., Accenture, Dallas, TX (October 2015-March 2016) 
 
Tasked with leading and coordinating Informatica data loads into and out of Salesforce.com to an 
Operational Data Store (ODS) as the ETL Lead for the Information Delivery/Data Services group at Novartis. 
I was responsible for coordinating all of the design, build, and deployment activities for a Data Integration 
team with 10-15 offshore Informatica developers. 
• Led and coordinated Informatica data loads into and out of Salesforce with 10-15 offshore 
Informatica Developers as the lead of a Data Integration team

• Led and coordinated Informatica data loads into and out of Salesforce with 10-15 offshore 
Informatica Developers as the lead of a Data Integration team 
• Managed the Customer Service and Technical Service deployment for Novartis’ United States and 
Switzerland affiliates 
• Responsible for team and release coordination of designing, building, and deploying interfaces into 
and out of Salesforce and ODS using Informatica PowerCenter 
• Leveraged Apex Data Loader to read/write CSV files to Salesforce Objects 
• Worked on Informatica Cloud (SAAS) creating mappings and data synchronization tasks to perform 
daily loads and incremental loads from Salesforce objects to Oracle and SQL server databases

Senior ETL Developer / Informatica Administrator – SASP 
United States Postal Service, Accenture, Washington, DC (July 2014-October 2015) 
 
Informatica Administrator and Technical Architect for the Seamless Acceptance and Service Performance 
(SASP) and Increased Visibility (IV) projects tasked with developing new Informatica processes based on 
requirements, optimizing performance, implementing enhancements to resolve mapping/workflow defects, 
and unit testing functionality.  
 
• Performed Unit Testing for ETL jobs by authoring UNIX scripts and staging data to appropriate 
Oracle 11G reference tables. Ensured data loading jobs accurately adhere to business requirements 
while regularly consulting with the client and Business Analysts 
• Informatica Administrator on the Technical Architecture team for the SASP and Increased Visibility 
(IV) teams for USPS responsible for investigating critical Informatica environment issues focusing on

(IV) teams for USPS responsible for investigating critical Informatica environment issues focusing on 
maintaining the stability and performance of all Informatica processes 
• Supported my project as the Subject Matter Expert specializing in Informatica environment failures 
as part of the Technical Architecture team. Extensive experience with Informatica server related 
issues related to Repository Services, Integration Services, and Informatica Nodes 
• Scheduled and Automated batch jobs and set-up of exception handling procedures 
• Led Performance tuning initiates at source, target, mappings, sessions, and system levels 
• Performed extensive data validation, identifying patterns and trends in data sets 
• Collected and interpreted data, and prepared reports based on analysis and presenting to 
management  
• Manage the lifecycle of code development, from ideation to sprints to deployment 
 
Senior ETL Developer – Fraud Data Analytics

management  
• Manage the lifecycle of code development, from ideation to sprints to deployment 
 
Senior ETL Developer – Fraud Data Analytics 
Department of Treasury (Internal Revenue Service), IBM, Washington, DC (Feb 2012-June 2014) 
 
Spearheaded the technical direction and implementation of highly efficient Informatica solutions that meet 
the performance requirement of Extracting, Processing, and Loading 1 million taxpayer returns in 15 minutes 
into the RRP Greenplum Solution Data Warehouse (SDW) as the Return Review Program (RRP) Informatica 
ETL Development team lead. SDW integrates and maintains many taxpayer return applications – electronic 
taxpayer data (MeF), paper taxpayer data (GMF), information returns master data (IRMF), etc. Developed 
and designed Dashboards and Detailed level Reporting built around the SDW using Business Objects 
Enterprise (BOE). 
• Provided Data Modeling, Data Architecture, ETL, Data Management, Deployment, Training and

Enterprise (BOE). 
• Provided Data Modeling, Data Architecture, ETL, Data Management, Deployment, Training and 
Technical Leadership for a variety of products delivered by the ETL Team. Leveraged the Agile 
SDLC methodology and Informatica, Unix scripting, Control-M Scheduling  
• Modeled 1100 individual and business return, entity, anomaly, process and error handling related 
tables 
• Processed a large number of files from twelve (12) data source systems containing extremely large 
volumes of data and loaded to the target tables using workload automation tool Control-M 
• Performed Unit Tests for ETL jobs by authoring Unix scripts and ensuring data-loading jobs 
accurately adhere to business requirements 
• Architected and developed the Data Model, Staging Database, mapping specs and ETL Architecture 
• Experienced with researching code written in Cobol, Oracle, XML, or flat-file based subsystems for 
ETL development

• Experienced with researching code written in Cobol, Oracle, XML, or flat-file based subsystems for 
ETL development 
• Gathered and translated business requirements into technical solutions as reports, Tableau 
dashboards, BOE reports, and scorecards to ensure business continuity and maintain efficiency 
• Scheduled ETL jobs with Control-M Enterprise Manager 
 
ETL Developer – Reporting and Design 
Nationwide Mutual Insurance Company, Columbus, Ohio (Feb 2011-September 2011)

Actively engaged in strategic team initiatives to build a high performing Agile team and drive continuous 
improvement processes and system efficiencies for the High Availability team. Standardized design reviews 
and knowledge retention-management processes. Participated and led technical leadership efforts. 
Responsible for analysis, design, and implementation of IT Systems metrics and reporting.  
 
• Pull data from Business Objects and other sources to produce monthly deck reports for Executives 
and Business Leaders using PowerPoint, Tableau, and SharePoint. These reports are used to 
communicate results for End User Downtime, Incident Tickets, Change Success Rates, Releases, 
and Batch Processing. 
• Participated and facilitated meetings with cross functional ETL teams to develop best practices and 
ETL code pattens 
• Acted as the Technical Lead to create design documents for converting Pro C codes to Informatica 
Mappings to match the Architectural Standards.

ETL code pattens 
• Acted as the Technical Lead to create design documents for converting Pro C codes to Informatica 
Mappings to match the Architectural Standards. 
• Developed SQL scripts and views for business-critical applications using Oracle tools such as 
WinSQL and Toad in collaboration with other Application Developers in an Agile environment 
• Worked with Associate Systems Administrators to perform systems analysis and job control in a 
Unix environment 
• Maintained, developed, and modified SQL shell files related to critical business applications 
• Involved in Design Reviews, Operational Excellence, and Continuous Improvement efforts to build a 
stronger support team
